messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE REPORT: BG-4029-XP DATE: 07/13/23  Burglary report from Baker's Avenue Residence. At approx 8:15 PM, Deputy P. Q. R. Stevens raised an alarm for a potential break-in. People Involved: Ms. Laura Chandler and Mr. Mike O'Leary. NOTICE - REQUIRED INVESTIGATION FROM: RESIDENTIAL CRIME DIVISION - QUICK RESPONSE NEEDED!  Sgt. S. T. U. Gomez arrived first, supported by Technician Emily. ADDRESS: 23 Baker's Ave. 20:45 Missing Jewels. Neighborhood dwellers Mr. Terry Winters and Mrs. Susan Quinn reported suspicious activities. Crime Lab Analyst Dave proceeded with collecting DNA samples.  SEND TO: RESIDENTIAL CRIME UNIT 7 - QUICK NOTES [UNDERLINE] Technician Emily, Sgt. Gomez. ON SITE: Deputy Stevens. RELATED DOCUMENTS: Quinn, Susan 45 Baker's Ave, Broadville, Kentucky 780-987. 00123. BAKER'S AVENUE 21:15 Loss of Property.  By 9:00 PM, Sgt. Gomez, working in coordination with Capt. V. W. X. Blake, had interviewed several witnesses. Officer Y. Z. A. Fisher and Officer B. C. D. Taylor were tasked with questioning Mr. O'Leary, who seemed nervous. By 9:45 PM, a neighboring resident, identified as Mrs. Janet Morgan, became a person of interest.  REPORT TO: RESIDENTIAL CRIME UNIT 7 - SUMMARY [CHECK] Technician Emily, Officer Fisher, Capt. Blake. PRIMARY INVESTIGATOR: Sgt. Gomez. EVIDENCE COLLECTED: (1) List of Missing Jewels (2) Eye-witness Accounts (3) DNA Analysis (4) Home Security Footage (5) Personal Testimonies of Residents (6) Footprints CHIEF INVESTIGATOR M. N. O. Howard R.C.U. 50.098 R15 4589 Chandler, LAURA. FILE: PLACE: CONTACT: 654-4321 DETECTIVE: P. Stevens REFERENCE: BG-0123- 555 BURGLARY TIME: 20:45 ID CODE 45678 - LOGGED Elizabeth Harper DATE 07/14/23 FORWARD TO: RESIDENTIAL CRIME UNIT.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Deputy P. Q. R. Stevens  
Officer Context: At approx 8:15 PM, Deputy P. Q. R. Stevens raised an alarm for a potential break-in.  
Officer Role: Deputy 

Officer Name: Sgt. S. T. U. Gomez  
Officer Context: Sgt. S. T. U. Gomez arrived first.  
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Technician Emily  
Officer Context: Sgt. S. T. U. Gomez arrived first, supported by Technician Emily.  
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Crime Lab Analyst Dave  
Officer Context: Crime Lab Analyst Dave proceeded with collecting DNA samples.  
Officer Role: Crime Lab Analyst 

Officer Name: Capt. V. W. X. Blake  
Officer Context: Sgt. Gomez, working in coordination with Capt. V. W. X. Blake.  
Officer Role: Captain 

Officer Name: Officer Y. Z. A. Fisher  
Officer Context: Officer Y. Z. A. Fisher and Officer B. C. D. Taylor were tasked with questioning Mr. O'Leary.  
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Officer B. C. D. Taylor  
Officer Context: Officer Y. Z. A. Fisher and Officer B. C. D. Taylor were tasked with questioning Mr. O'Leary.  
Officer Role: Officer
